alert.note: Alert for Canadian; Garfield; Kingfisher; Logan; Noble; Oklahoma; Payne (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 02 at 6:43AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Kingfisher, western Oklahoma, southwestern Noble, Logan, southwestern Payne, southeastern Garfield and Canadian Counties through 730 AM CDT... At 643 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles southeast of Hennessey to 5 miles northeast of Calumet. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oklahoma City, Edmond, Stillwater, Del City, El Reno, Guthrie, Kingfisher, Yukon, Bethany, Warr Acres, The Village, Piedmont, Nichols Hills, Hennessey, Langston, Crescent, Okarche, Cashion, Calumet and Dover. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 125 and 178. Interstate 40 between mile markers 109 and 154. Interstate 44 between mile markers 118 and 140. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
